page.description: Get the HTML inside a container and convert to PDF.

item.name: Container Id
item.description: Specify the container Id. Choices include.

item.name: Client-side filename
item.description: Specify the client side filename to suggest when the user downloads the PDF file. To dynamically compute the clientside filename using a Javascript function, specify the filename as: function:FUNCTION_NAME. For example: function:myfunc. In this example 'myfunc' is a Javascript function that will return the client-side filename to use.

item.name: Xbasic function
item.description: Specify the name of the xbasic function. The function takes 'e' as a parameter. the 'e' object contains e.filename - the filename of the PDF file that was created.

item.name: Enable forms
item.description: TURNED THIS OFF BECAUSE IF SEEMS TO BREAK THE TEXTBOX CONTROLS - NO VALUE IS SHOWN

item.name: Units for all measurements
item.description: Units for all measurements property. Choices include *[ui:px]*, *[ui:in]*, *[ui:cm]*, *[ui:mm]*, *[ui:pt]*, *[ui:tw]*, *[ui:px]*.

item.name: CSS override definitions
item.description: Define CSS classes to override defined CSS styles. This will allow you to have special classes on controls when the HTML is saved to PDF. A typical use case for this feature is to turn off the border on controls when they are printed. TIP: Use the .{style} placeholder in selector names to make your definition work with any component style. For example, to turn off the border on textboxes: {style}Edit {border: none;}

item.name: Suppress borders on controls
item.description: Specify if the border that is normally displayed around edit controls should be suppressed.
